intro: Antherocephala, commonly known as the "spearhead flower," is a genus of flowering plants native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Antherocephala species often thrive in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticultural enthusiasts and botanists.
